page.title: 14Twyning Church bells.
page.content: The 6 bells were cast by Rudhall in 1723. The 4 heaviest are in a 15th. century frame. They are rung twice weekly for service and practice. { {EXTRACT, A.G.M.Jan.1985:}Lighting and power have been installed in the belfry. The clappers need replacing. Work is in hand to deflect the sound over a wider area. The captain was pleased at the progress of the band. We have 4 Stedman ringers but rely on visitors to ring this and Minor. Our first Tower Outing ever is on Feb. 23rd to Kempsey, Powick, St.Johns Worcester, and Earls Croome.{ { {TEWKESBURY BRANCH STRIKING COMPETITION This was held at Kemerton, on June 16. 5 bands took part, from Twyning, Deerhurst and Tewkesbury. Twyning came 2nd. to Tewkesbury 'A' band!
